definition[0]: to balance one situation or quality against another, in order to produce an acceptable result
example[0]: Companies are under pressure to trade off price stability for short-term gains.
definition[1]: a balance between two opposing things, that you are willing to accept in order to achieve something
example[1]: There has to be a trade-off between quality and quantity if we want to keep prices low.
note[1]: a trade-off between something and something
definition[2]: to balance two situations against each other in order to get an acceptable result
example[2]: Companies are under pressure to trade off price stability for short-term gains
definition[3]: a balance between two situations in order to get an acceptable result
example[3]: The legal restrictions will remain as a trade-off for allowing interstate investment.
